title: Sandy is back
text:
- Sandy is coming back  today and need to pick her up from JFK today. Clean up the house a bit to get ready for her. Her flight was delayed so had a little bit of time for work and prepare a house. Didn't have to rush at all.
- Going  there was not too bad. Only got yelled by some truck driver because I didn't move fast enough when 4 lanes merged into one after the toll booth. 
- I arrived a bit early so stayed a parking lot near the beach. It has a older row boat washed almost to the shore. Took some pictures of that and went back to the car since the beach it was a bit dirty and cold.
- Picking up Sandy was pretty easy. The air port was not too busy, but there was a lot of people picking up people. Luckily Sandy saw my car and I saw her so picked her up pretty easily.
- Going back was easy as well, but Sandy put a longer route to get home. However, I kinda knew where I was so I turned around and went the correct way, the way I came over. Arrived a bit late so didn't have time to get dinner.

title: Break neck ridge hike with shortcut
text:
- Anvar joked that parking was almost full
- Diana was late..again but not too bad
- Short cut instead of doing a scramble, still need to do scramble a bit. Took shorter path. Anvar had to push dogs up the rocks. He went the harder way in the beginning, but had to go backtrack and go the easier way that the rest of the group went. 
- Trekking poles going downhill definitely helped, going down was little bit steep. 
- Interesting rocks at the trail. A lot of them are metamorphic rocks such as ghenesis. Don't see a lot of sand stone as other mountains around here. Maybe because the mountain is by the river and the sand stone was eroded away.  Found some coal at the trail for some reason at the trail.  
- Some person brought a cake that shared with us
- Before going uphill we took a small break and a big group passed us. We started to hike soon after and then we passed them, so we arrived to the top first and we occupied the overlook first. The other people we waiting for us to leave. 
- Dog started to eat my sandwich when we stopped at the rock. I was laying on the rock and Anvar's dog was started to sniff my backpack and I figured out that it was trying to get my sandwich that was in my backpack outside pocket.
- was looking to put hammock at the break, but there were not a good place to it if I wanted to be close to people.
- Elnaras son failed school joined Army Guard. Like me he also told about it the last minute. The way she described and complained was similar to my situation so I just walked forward of her talking. The son had an ultimatum to join US Army or Arjebazan army.

title: Wrist pain hurt
text:
- Wrist pain in both hands from typing too much. I had a slight pain/soreness earlier this week, but it got better since I put a towel as a wrist rest for a keyboard, but I had been typing too much in preparation to my CKAD exam. I think I do too much wrist flexion. On Sunday was researching if getting ergonomic keyboard will help me. Sunday night was researching this topic and it took me a while to get to sleep. Decided to get a split keyboard.
- Next day tried to use low profile/provided by a company keyboard. It worked a bit and was not feeling as much soreness at the end of the day. Maybe that my keyboard was too high was causing m problems?
- The rest of the week tried not too type as much and the paint/soreness seem to get less and less over the time.

title: Easy non political hike, but people didn't show up
text:
- This week decided to go to local forest and then have an after party at my place. Ruslan was supposed to join us, but he had to do some other stuff. He said that he is planning to move, and he needs time to prepare for it. Diana was supposed to join us as well, but she hiked with Anvar the day prior and she injured herself and not able to join us as well. So no more coming over to my place after the hike. 
- Joked at the beginning of the hike that we are not supposed to talk about politics during the hike since last time one of the person was talking about it too much and started to argue with people during the lunch. However, people started talking about politics after all. How elections are going to be and who vote for. At the end of the hike Sergey and other  person was debating how WWII came to life and what happened with Finland after WWII
- Took a break at the gazebo. It is nice resting location since we had a big table that can fit everyone and we stayed there for a while just talking and not doing much.
- It was getting hot today even when hiking on flat surface. Soon we will need to start hike early in the morning to avoid  the heat.
- Mostly talked with Yakov since the other people talked about politics and I and Dimka had not a lot to contribute to conversation. He and his wife went to Olympia national park so I asked  him some questions about his trip since we are planning to there
- The end of the hike went to white trail where additional lakes. The trail was washed up and some people were hesitant to continue to go since the wood that was to cross stream was slightly under the water. I decided to take my shoes off since we are just going to walk a little and water should be nice and cold. It was nice walking on the sand for a little bit and crossing the stream such that Dimka also took his shoes off when crossing the stream on the way back.
- There were some new people in our group that are new to hiking/don't hike as much. So they were sligtly complaining that we took a detour to see lakes
- Saw that plant that eats animals. Yakov pointed out how it supposed to look like.
- Decided to eat ramen again. Dimka is liking that place a lot

title: Long hike in Delaware water gap
text:
- This weekend gong to delaware water gap for a hike. Started early, so had to get up a little bit than usual
- Sveta pulled out snow car brush instead of hiking pole and he was getting out her trecking pole from Dimka's car
- Ilgiz joined us, but he was struggling going uphill with us. He was going in the last. Maybe about an mile in, he decided to go back. He was out of shape to catch up with us and he haven't done any execsises for a long time
- There was a lot of water on the trail since it been raining previous days. I was wearing trail runners and thicker socks and was afraid that I would get my shoes wet. At the beginning of the train I though that I should have worn hiking boots, but at the end of the hike realized that I made a correct decisions. It was getting too warm to wear hiking boots by the end of the hike. Because there was a lot of rain before, some of the waterfalls and streams were full of water. We decided to go on the ridge line trail instead of stream since we were afraid that the trail would be flooded.
- Stopped at the lake for out lunch break. I forgot to bring titanium cup for tea, so I used coffee cup instead. Dimka forgot his tea, so I gave some of mine. 
- There was some snow at the trail so we made a snow man. The snow was on the north facing slope. 
- Going last uphill and downhill was a tiring. We are at 10 miles mark already. Had to stop a bit when going uphill. 
- After the hike got pizza and ate it at my place with Dimka

We had to go straigh, but people decided to turn. there were some marks on the trees, but they werent the marks for the trail. I decided to continue since the trail was just there, and other people went the correct way. Sat on the rock a bit while waiting for people to show up.

I think they are doing it section by section since it we are half way in the trail and some people only just starting to hike. Say a beer can on trail. I assume it is for people who are hiking.

title: Hike by ourselver to waterfall, to early to hike with Anvar
text:
- Anvar is organizing a hike in delaware water gap where he would make plov like last year
- His hike is at 10, but it was too early for Sandy to wake up so decided to go for our own hike
- Decided to go to buttermilk falls since it rained previous day
- Was cold a bit at the start of the hike, saw some ice on ponds
- Glad that had gloves with me and so Sandy
- Was walking by a lake by a bit, but decided to go into forest to get away from the wind
- Sandy is now good with bushwhacking. There was a puddle all over the trail, and had bushwack a bit. She had difficulty figuring out the way to go.
- Found some ruins next to the lake that didn't see before. It was interesting adventure and find
- Going to to lake using unification trail. Noticed that there used to be a road here and some electricity poles
- First part of going to waterfall was pretty steep, and we were glad that we don't have to go the same way again. There was some ice on rocks so we had to walk around it
- Had a nice lunch at the waterfall. It was pretty chilly sitting down and we had to wear all out layers. The blanket came in hand to covering our legs. Had some fancy cheese, fancy bread for lunch. The bod for candy was the perfect size for carrying our food. Decided to boil water instead of carrying water bottle since water bottle doesn't keep water as warm as it used to.
- Going up was a bit of a challenge. Sandy was almost crying internally. It a challenging uphill, at the end my legs were feeling it a bit. I tried to run up the hill and got the cramp in my quad at the end
- At the end of our hike we saw a beaver near its hut. Used monocular to look at it, but it was too far too see, but it was cool anyways. 
- Finished the hike almost the time it got dark. The sun was setting and the time we were driving out the sun was setting in behind the mountains. I wanted to go to overlook and see the sunset, but the time I went to see it. The sun was already down.
- At the end of the hike were a bit hungry. Were talking about going to hot dog place on the way there. Aparently it is very popular and it  has a lot of people all the time. Went there just in time it was closing. Maybe 15 minutes before closing time, and I wanted to skip it, but Sandy persisted that we go. Standed on the door mat while people mopped the floor. At least we got some energy into us. We had some beech beer as a drink. It was not too bad, but Sandy was not too keen about it since for her it tasted like a medicine.

title: Shenandoah Trip
text:
Going to Shenandoah this weekend. Decided to go there since Sandy heard about this park, but never been there. It was pretty close drive, some of the drive was familiar when I went to West Virginia. As we got to the park, we stopped at the first available overlook. There we a lot of overlooks to choose from, and after a while we got used to all the overlooks. The other people had similar reaction to overlooks as us. It got pretty foggy shortly after we drove, and we drove in the fog for a little bit. The overlooks that we saw in the beginning were the only overlooks that we saw that day.

Stopped at the caverns before we got to our yurt. It was a nice experience since I haven't been in those caverns before. Coworker had recommended visiting these caverns as well. Apparently they are biggest caverns in t he US. There was a organ that hits rocks and makes as sounds. Previously this cavers been used as weddings reception as well and balls room. The yurt was pretty close to the caverns which was pretty nice. Drove through the town to see how it looks like. It is just main street and older PA town.

Yurt was pretty nice, and it was out first experience staying in yurt. Had plenty of open space to store out stuff and had a microwave and fridge. Definitely worth the convenience to hiking location and the town. 

The day prior it was raining and some of the firewood was slightly damp. I failed to start a fire even though I used fire started. I could have started it, but it would taken me longed to do it, so we gave up and decided to continue next day. Decided to go for dinner in Italian place to eat. We went there for all days for dinner since we enjoyed and didn't want to change things up. During the night cuddled a lot since it been a little cold outside. First time that we felt asleep hugging each other. I tried to get away from sandy, but got to her right away since it was cold outside. At the end of the  night I was at the edge of the bed while Sandy is cuddling me.

First day we hiked through  big meadows. I made joke that it looked like lake district UK. I didn't have map with me so I had to improvise what trails to take. Wanted to go through meadows for sure, so slightly modified our plan. Found place where park stores some it equipment. It was a nice detour. It was all the way down. The midpoint was a former president summer residency. We had tour of the house and we got lucky that park ranger was there to show us it. This attraction was a nice and accident addition to our hike. Improvised our way back since it would take us 7 miles to go back if planned to go the trail that planned originally.  The improvised hike worked and we did about 8 miles that day. When we came out from the woods, the cars were everywhere. Some cars parked on the grass. We got a premium parking spot since we got there in the morning. On the way back there was some traffic to get to the park exit. We saw a lot of people parked everywhere. The wood dried out more or less, so had a small fire going. Had to do some extra preparation to get fire going. Used fire to dry out some of the remaining of the wood. 

Second day was a harder hike, did a loop again. It was going all the way down and then straight up for 3-4 miles. Decided to go other direction that all trails said. All trails wanted to go speed down and more gradual going uphill. It was correct decision when we started going uphill. On the way down there were a lot of nice waterfall and we were walking by the creek. Got some few nice views but it was mostly in the forest. Stopped for lunch at one of waterfalls. Were getting tired a bit as we got closer to midpoint. Not stopping for views as much anymore. Sandy had to peed, but she was concerned about snakes. She was jealous that I could pee anywhere I wanted. She started to look for spots shortly after I went. However , the canyon got narrower and hillside steeper with less opportunities to find a spot. Shortly after she peed we found a sight that to be wary of snakes in the area.

Going uphill was pretty difficult, and we had to do plenty of small breaks. First one was by the waterfall. The mat and green blanket came in handy to we don't get too cold when sitting on cold rock. Sat there a bit and continued on. One of my concerns that time was that it might get dark soon. At some points the sun was behind the mountain on out left. I had headlamp and flashlight just in case for such scenarios. Talked to some of the ranger he approved that we chose the way we did out loop. It would been a lot of scrambling if we went the direction all trails suggested. Sandy is not completely healed up yet as well.

title: PA backpacking turned camping
text:
First da
Anvar organized backpacking that turned into camping trip instead. We are going to day hike things that we were planning to backpack. Arrived there Friday evening. Going to PA now.  Realized that socks that I kept in me hiking backpack got wet. The bottle lid was leaking. I dried them off by using heater seats and seating on them and by using window defrost.  It was too dark too see mountains when I got of the highway. Followed car after a highway for about 20 minutes on a dark road. Met with Anvars friend. They went to same college together. The reason why it became a camping trip was because of him. He didn't think he would be able to do backpacking physically. It was drizzling and we used umbrella to hide under it. Anvar's friend had it. When Anvar arrived the umbrella was to small for 3 of us. Used tent shell and umbrella to cover ourselves from rain. We felt like we are homeless people. Drank some bear and had dinner, chat and go to sleep. The green David's rain jacket was pretty nice especially since it covered up legs. Sadly I forgot to bring my lightweight poncho. Maybe for the future would need to bring/buy tarp for this reason. Forgot a reflective blanket tarp as well. I set up tent in light rain, but it wasn't too bad. Thought that someone was trying to open cars doors thought the night. It was Anvars friend. It was nice that that it was raining since I couldn't hear Anvars snoring too much. Quillt worked pretty nice, just needed to adjust straps correctly. 

10 mile hike
It was still raining when we got to the trail. Decided to wait it out a little bit for wearer to get better. Anvar missed a trail and we had to do little bit of bush wacking. I thought that I saw the trail before but I thought that Anvar knew better where to  go. He is not great with navigation. Most of the talked to Kosta. Talking about the cost of housing of ownership. Had only one overlook for the entire day, the majority of the trail was inside forest. Found some pipelines on the trail. It was an interesting location for the lunch. The trail was pretty steep at the times. At one point is was really steep to go down. Glad that we didn't do backpacking and choose camping instead. At the end of the trail had some minor blister happening, but we were almost at the end of the trail.  Got some tape, but the blisters were really minor. Drove at the back of minivan to pick up our cars from the start of the trail. We made jokes that we are bunch of immigrants. 

Dinner
Singing sapogi mertveca, all got quet. Should have a playlist that I prepared to play when people ask to sing them something. Was trying to start fire. Some of the wood was little bit damp, so had trouble starting fire. Kostya brought some dry firewood with him and it helped fire going on. The fire started was pretty nice to use as well. Going to buy more of it after I run out. 

15 miles hike
Second day of hike was mostly on the forest as well with not many overlooks. Decided to go around, and take longer path so we don't need to go up and down mountain. It was worth detour since the hills are steep here. The trail would be where the erosion would be. One of the guy with us was an alpinist from soviet. He talked about his experience with that, and it was interesting to hear how people did it during soviet union. People made their own gear, down jackets, and he ordered titanium spikes from factory he worked at. Encountered more gas lines on the trail. It looks like there is a lot of fraking in these mountains. Decided to make another trail change and we walked on pipeline road for a bit. It was a good chanvge of pace because we could walk side by side and talk and it would not as steep or rocky as regular trail. Saw several dead snakes on the trail. Came down to another rail trail. At this point my feet were hurting a little bit since walking on hard surfaces is not comfortable in my shoes. At mile 8 got to a minivan that was left as just in case. The rest of the carts were in the beginning or at the end of the trail. Had some lunch on blanket there. A lot of people were not concerned leaving food in their car as I did, so got some extra food in me. Some people decided to go home from this point and some of us continued on. Anvar missed a trail again, and almost started bushwhacking again. Looked at my map and saw where we had to go. It was a little bit confusing since we had to go through road that looked like a driveway. Struggling with the last uphill a bit. At the end of trail saw only couple of overlooks for the entire trail again. Anvar lost trail again when coming down. He missed a turn when hiking in front of us and didn't see where we could cross the river.

Going home
Missed a turn to go on interstate. Stopped to get some Panera bread on the way back

title: Backpacking Catskills with sandy
text:
Start
Trying out backpacking with Sandy this weekend. I choose a very easy route that she might enjoy, nothing too strenuous. Decided to stay the same place where Anvar and I stayed when we did Devil's Path. Chose this place because campground it is open about 8 pm and will take us some time to get there. Sandy was also coming from her work trip in the afternoon, so there is no chance to go to campsite early.

Getting there was not too bad. Way less cars compared to when we went there over public holiday. Adaptive cruise controll worked great. It s a nice feature to have on long road trip. Taking my car for long trip for sure from now on. Got to the campground close to closing time, but it was all good. We were the only people at the campground, so we could choose any campsite. Drove a little bit to find out spot. Drove little bit "off road" to circle around. The original campsite was too rocky for tent to sleep. So drove around the campground to find a spot. Got out to see if place is correct. Conveniently had flashlight in my trunk so we can explore. Walked around and found flat and non rocky place at the bottom of the hill. All the soil is washed here from the hill. It is was very close place where we slept last year. Got firewood from last time and had a nice campfire going. A lot of noises of frogs, owls, coyotes, and trains in campsite.

Start of the trip was not too bad. It was not raining yet as we were afraid of. In the beginning it was kinda chilly. When about to start hands were cold. Asked if Sandy needed gloves since she was trying to get her hands warm while we walked. After couple minus of hike turned around and got cloves from my car. Luckily I had to pairs of gloves in my car. Uphill was not too bad since it was pretty wide trail. Stopped at one of the shelter for the out lunch. It had overlook right next to where we stayed. As we started to have lunch more rain came in and the overlook was covered by the clouds. We were for nice overlook just in time since it would be our last overlook the entire trip. Decided no to go to ski resort area since it is raining and that area is exposed unlike forest. We made a correct decision since there would be no views to see. Everything would be covered in clouds. Came up to fire tower. Had a small tour of fire tower gatekeeper hut. When went to on top, barely see anything. Tour of fire tour hut was the highlight of the day so far. Rain jacket worked pretty well in small rain.

Got pretty happy that modified the tent.There were too many rocks in the ground. Longer guylines definitely helped to find where can find where to put stakes it. Had to us one of the metal piece to get steak fixed in. The tent was perfect for two people. It was wide enough. There was a lot of wind during a wind and was little bit concerned that the wind would break down the tent. However, the tent stood up. Sandy was worried about it as more than I did.

Tried to watch movie while in tent. Put a tripod on a string so phone hangs from roof of the tent. I am leaving that close line inside the tent. Sandy felt asleep 20 minutes into the movie which was pretty funny. Heard some noises through the night. Probably some animals near by, but ursack worked. Quilt worked pretty well. Can't beat its weight. However there were some drafts coming it. It might been because I was in the way of the wind. Will try to adjust straps next time. Surprisingly there were a lot of people on the trail backpacking and some even decided to do the entire devil path event though it was raining and cold


Second Day
Woke up in the low cloud mist. Everything was wet and covered in dew. Going down was super boring it was all rocks and down hill. Came to overlook, but it was all covered in clouds and because of that decided not to got to second Hunter mountain and second big uphill. Came to waterfall. It was pretty nice again, but not as many yellow leafs as last time. Went to the same place for food as last time and they messed up our check again.

text:
Rented out cabin for Catskills. It was nice and not far away from trails. Tried to do astrophotography with camera again. Got some handy since Sandy was on her period. Deciding to where to backpack in Catskills in few weeks.Have general idea where to go.

On the way back went to small railroad museum. It was former train station and it was interesting local history. Went to get food before we head out. We got our order and were waiting for the bill. However we had to pay after food ourselves.

title: West Virginia Trip
text:
West Virginia trip by myself, decided to take vacation since i have some time accumulated. Worked nicely especially since Sandy went to China. I found about the place just looking at map and looking what pictures posted. Found some interesting rocks/cliffs and wanted to see where it is. The drive was only about 5-6 hours and was not too bad. My car made it there pretty nicely. 

The first stop that I stooped was at Scenica rocks. It was a reason why I went to this area. On the way there there were a lot of signs that explained geology of the area and general geology information. Took some pictures of that for my further information. Going downhill decided to go different way where mostly climbers go. Glad that I had trekking poles with me since the going downhill was pretty steep. Without them don't think I would be able to go there. 

The cabin was plenty for me. I like this type of camping since I don't need to worry about hiding from bears. It was mostly RV part with some cabins on the side. Next time will need to find a campsite that have tent sides and cabin on the side. While I was walking around looking for a signal, I dropped my keys somewhere. I did a lap around and didn't see them. Luckily, I knew how to open doors with a credit card from watching videos and listening podcasts about physical security. Was not worried about keys after got inside, but walked a second lap and found keys in the dirt. The campsite was on opposite side of mountain where all hikes were. Should have choose different campsite, so didn't have to drive as much. But it was fun driving over mountain passes every day. Got more comfortable over time and tried to keep up with cars in front of me who are more local to it.

Tried to do astrophotography with camera, but it didn't work because of earth rotation and it is harder to focus on the starts

Was worried about the rain the next day, so was thinking if should go to a hike or take a train ride. It started to rain early in the evening. Took some nice pictures of the fog in the trees. Too bad couldn't stop somewhere to do in with my camera. It kinda reminded me of Humboldt since there is also a lot of fog in the tree. Luckily it was not raining next day, and I did a impromptu hike to the top of the mountain. Too bad there was not an overlook as I expected. wanted to see fog in the trees. At one point wanted to take a bushwhack short cut on the way back, but decided to just back track my steps. There were a lot of ferns and area was very wet compared to other side of the mountain. There were no rain on other side. Guess the mountains stop all the rain.

The original hike that I planned was all 3 miles all uphill. Took me a while to get there and was exhausted by the end of it. Had to stop and lay down for a bit before went on the way up. The views were pretty cool since could see the erosion cliffs and chimney rocks. Saw found some cool rocks as well. Met some people doing a a backpacking as well. Asked them about it and it is double to do the trail in few days. Was definitely by the end of the hike

Decided to eat ac camp store for the dinners. It was more convenient that going into town. Probably will stay on this side of the mountain if I go there in the future. 

Was little bit late for rock climbing and was stuck behind the log truck, but I have made it on time. It was interesting experience. All scrambling helped with climbing. Used a lot of upper body. My grip gives up since it was sweating a lot needed to take breaks. Needed to bring liquid chalk with me. Was not too scary even thought far away from ground.

Last day doing white river rafting. It was not too hard or too excited. Next time need need to choose more challenging route. One person felt over. Felt slightly weird about this situation since going to go to LA tomorrow, so fun is not as much and thinking about other things.

text:

It would be a perfect place for a date, and me and Sandy enjoyed if while other people came over. Not surprisingly Diana was late for even her birth day. title: Snowshoeing for the first time
text:
First time show shoeing. It been telling myself three times already that it would be my last time hiking in snow, but I was wrong. Like a last time carpooled from North Jersey to Catskills. This time I went went with Anvar. As we got closer to the trail heard, there was more snow. At some point I was concerned that there won't be any snow. There was plenty of snow once we gained elevation. At some points it were couple feet. Started with microspikes because there weren't enough snow and transitioned to snow shoes once we started to fall through snow. Anvar decided not to take microspikes with him because he decided it too much too carry. He started with snow shoes, but had to take them off because there weren't enough snow. So he was struggling for grip at some points when he had to go uphill.

The first uphill was most intense for me. At some points I was really struggling and was wondering if bulking is even worth it. Being ~180 lbs has it own detriments when hiking. Once we gained elevation, we started to fall into snow and had to put snow shoes. It was different experience walking in them and I had to get used to it. Anvar fell a lot because he would step on his own snow shoes and trip. He was definitely struggling adjusting to them. Even we had small group most of people walked their own pace.

Bushwhacking was an interesting route. There were a lot of snow and it was supper steep. Even snow shoes didn't help to stay on top of snow at some points. The didn't help with grip either. Slid several times an landed on my butt several times as I was coming from steep hill. Once we approached our last incline I drank some red bull to get it over it. Anvar was really struggling with this uphill.

At the top we found a canister that we record our names. Yura is really knowledgeable about Catskills. He was telling about all crashed airplanes that people can find here. At the top we decided to take a shorted route and not to summit Mt rocky. It would be too much for us in terms of endurance and time wise. 

Going back I started to get blisters. Most likely the way I attached my snow shoes. We had second lunch and I was able to access the situation. My socks and shoes were completely wet. The shoes are not as waterproof as they say they are. I applied leukotape and changed socks and continued on.

At the end I didnt feel as dead as last time I went hiking in winter here. My endurance might be improving after all. Just need to keep it up so I am ready for the backpacking trips.

title: People got scared because of weather hike
text:
Organized hike for bear Mountain NY since Dimka has drill this weekend and Anvar still on travel. Didn't really check weather prior making the event. I was supposed to rain in the morning of the hike and day prior, so some people were conserved coming or not. However, the weather was perfect. It wasn't raining or snowing at all. The only people showed up are Sergey and Nadia, and one more person decides to come last minute. We waited her in the hotel lobby.

The adventure begin pretty much in the beginning. There was a lot of snow on the side of mountain where the trail was. It was a lot of slush snow it was really slippery. We were slightly concerned that the entire trail is going to be like that. I event thought of making a shortcut and going 2-3 miles less than been planned. However, as we went on top, the other side of mountain didnt have as much snow and it was pretty passable. The initial trail was on north side and had big valley in front of it. I guess that this mountain stopped all snow coming over the mountain. The view was nice at the top. It is all I wanted. Low mountain really hid the ugly bold mountains.Took pictures of nice view from there. Had lunch there as well. It was a nice break, and we didn't want to move at all. Going down started to be sunny for a change, and we had to loose even more layers. I remembered spots where I filtered some water and the road I took then I did my section hike. After going downhill it was all forest now. A lot of trail was flooded, and my shoes definitely got wet. 

Part of the trail we waled was where British solders walked in 1777 when they attacked local fort. It was an interesting part of history. After I realized that there is not as much snow anymore, I realized that we can prolonged out hike slightly. We did some loops to get some extra miles. The abandoned village was pretty nice to visit as well. read a history about it. It was a miner village, they had couple schoolhouses and a church and about 300 people living there. The state wanted to expand the park and bought up the neighboring lands. However, family still owns a plot of land there that is used as an active cemetery. It was cool to visit is as well. The ruins that I saw at the map looked like some water treatment plant. Unfortunately it was fenced off and was fenced by bushed and I was with other people. Would diffidently try to explore it if I went by myself.

Conversations wise it was more small talk, but I have tried to ask more open ended questions to a new member of a group. It worked, and should continue it during the hikes.

Checked radiator cap again. There is still some hard crust on radiator cap again. It is harder compered the first time I saw it. The oil and coolant still looks fine and correct color. I guess that there is no head gasket leak as I was worried about. Still might try to get new car probably after current project is over when I will know that my next job/how long project is going to be or wait till something breaks breaks. Looking at market the price of car ~30K and not everything is available. Might get Crosstreck because it more like a car and not a SUV.

title: Blue lakes hike second time
text:
Hiking to Buttermilk and Crater lake again. However, we parked at the bigger parking lot. The road to original parking lot was closed anyways. We had relatively big group this time. About 20 people showed up. I knew at least most of them. Lisa, my date from from Hinge, showed up as well. The funny thing happened that another person from hike knew her as when she was a child. However, Lisa didn't recognize her at first and she was shocked to to see someone that knew her. It was made a funny information from it. 

It snowed the day before and it was nice that there was some snow on the ground. Looks way better  compared to just empty ground. Additionally , the fog from the snow was still in there. It hid some of the bald mountains. There was a frost on the trees and and pine needles. Crater lake looked even more beautiful, but waterfall was slightly dried.

I was in charge of leading the group again since I made a route. Compared to last time, we only turned in wrong was only twice. The one time we were 10 meters away from the correct turn. The second time was deciding if turn left or right on intersection. GPS doesn't show where to torn on the crossroads and map didn't have the trail that we eventually took.

Had better social interactions with all the people. Talked about half of the group, and had some interesting conversations. I guess better that regular with talking wit people. Definitely should continue this trend. 

Roma brought his roommate to the hike. Nadia said that they are not roommates, but that they are dating. They were close to each other at the hike, and by the end of the hike they were holding hands already.

title: No more drill, react developer
text:
Asked Noel if I really need to be in the upcoming comex. I already turned in my gear and it would be my last drill anyways. Luckily for me, I was to that I don't have to go. It would be nice not to be at drill during the week day. I won't miss any work/loose money because of the drill.

Getting in a specific role at my work. Now I am a doing front end for the most with React, something I am comfortable with. Java Spring Boot doesn't excite me at all. Still remember how to do CSS though.The only thing that kicking my butt is TypeScript.

title: Revisiting Hickory Run
text:
Revisiting Hickory Run State Park. I been there by myself year ago, but now I have to lead hiking group. Since I been here before with camera by by myself I had time to get all the picturesque places. Still was able to capture different viewpoints since there was some ice and my photography skills might have gotten better. The rail was pretty much as the last time I was there, but going to overlook where the bridge was. Everyone seen to enjoy the views since it was near creek for the most part. Once we went uphill is where people started to slow down. However, the view was worth it. The woods were almost the same as on other hill that I visited here. A lot of stand alone trees and shrubs and tall grass. I don't think I will need to go to other trail since it is going to look the same. We finally arrived to the overlook, and people were happy to finally rest. They been asking when  is the stop since we hiked about 5-6 miles at that point.

There is a definitely a downside leading a group. Had to be in front of everyone and have little chance to interact with other people. I let other people in front of me and told them I would let them know if they in the wrong path.

The rest was really nice, and everyone seen to enjoy it. Poke fun of Diana that we are going to gift her a backpack since she asked Dimka to carry some of her things. Gift her a cup since she wanted by tea, but didn't have it or any place she can put it. Enjoyed my seat pad as well since I don't have access to poncho liner. Still going to work if I something happens and I need to stay in woods for a bit. Backpack can a serve as sleep padding as well. So I think I am ready for spending night in the woods if something happens unless it is too cold.

Going back turned wrong places couple times. People who went in front of us missed a turn and continued forwards. Had to whistle to get their attention. Another guy decided to take a leek on the trail that we missed. Turned too soon because and had to backtrack for couple minutes, but saw a trail in few minutes. Also., in the beginning went of train where I thought the trail was. We just climbed a hill and saw a trail. The GPS showed that we were trail, so I got confused about the directions. 

At the end of hike we wanted to get some food. However, there is were not many places to eat. The first place that we went was just a bar that serves food. Additionally, smoking inside was allowed, so we decided to go somewhere else. Diana was adamant on getting Indian food even though it was located inside a gas station in middle of nowhere. The place had small cosmetic defects, but food was alright. It looked kinda like a gas station, but better. Sveta and her group decided to go somewhere else since the place was too downscale and they wanted to sit down somewhere nice, but Diana wanted to get some food. I think I saw a cocorach as some point coming out from garbage bin...so not sure if want to visit again.

title: Moorestown Photography
text: Had some free time and decided to do some local photography. It was 3 day weekend and I had a chance for street photography. I am still struggling with that to some extent. On of the options was to go to cape may, but it was too far away, and would take too long to drive. The downtown was pretty small, but I still got some decent shots. Then walked around the  residential area. It was pretty interesting place. A lot of older buildings closely packed together. Also, the near railroad left a mark on housing as well. Some of the houses looked that they were where railroad workers and working class peopel used to live.

title: First Hinge data
text: Going to first Hinge date. Almost got cancelled because of the rain. However, I was kinda persistent that we meet. One of the original plans was to go there by underground, so I drove there. Philly looks pretty cool. I would definitely visit it to get pictures of older building and architecture. The date was alright. More small talk and getting each other. Probably need to start asking questions with more substance. Something about the future and goals. She is pretty chubby, so that was a no for me, at least she is nice person. I was trying to overlook her appearance as the date went on. We had a dinner and scattered to our ways

title: Home station drill...getting closer
text:
my days with guard is getting closer to the end. This drill is staying behind so that I can turn in my gear and help with supply. Thursday helped with loading gear for people that were going to the field. Got my award for COVID mission. People were confused since it was Air Force medal.  Sat in the vault, and supply sergeant thought that I was hiding since I was supposed to do something even though he told me nothing about it. We were to check radios, but all the batteries were dead. We just waited for them to be charged. Other supply sergeant came by to told us what to do. We were mostly waiting to be released at some point. We got told that we need to pick up gov from fort Dix. The other guy and I were confused about it since we no one told it about it. There were a lot of confusion about. Apparently it was task that were supposed to do, but no one told us about. We were confused and annoyed about it for sure. Our time is not being valued at all. Wix came in to get us with the van. In the process he had to cut one of the lock to get a whiteboard for his section. Luckily, all we had to do was to pick vehicle and bring it to the armory, didn't have to stay in the field. Still got back home around 2300 because of this stupid and late task

I turned all my gear, and didn't have anything missing surprisingly. Supply sergeant tried to scare me with what happens if I am missing some gear. He was gone for the most of the day, and I just chilled with supply people for the most of the day doing nothing while recon people were working in the vault. Don't feel bad about shaming at all. I been working hard, plus I don't have much care in the world. It is interesting how different people perceive you. I am mostly smart and hard working with people I work with, but with new group of people I don't have such privilege. Once supply sergeant came back, I joined people in the vault to clean the weapons. At the end of the drill there were thinking that I am supply person. I guess I give that vibe since I was able to talk with supply people freely. 

The last days of the drill was all just cleaning weapons and receiving weapons in the vault. It was a nice hidy hole from all moving around when people came from the field. Saturday we stayed in the armory overnight. Because higher ups didn't want anyone to leave since super bowl was the next day. Sleeping in the cot wasn't as comfortable as it used to. I guess I got bigger because of the bulking. It felt slightly narrower than it is usually. Even Jimenez said that my back is looking wider now. 

Mendilo was locked in the vault in over night. He set up his cot there. Some one overnight closet the vault door and spinned the combo. He was able to open it from inside and get out. However, they need to to figure out how to set vault door into state that would allow them it to close back. It wouldn't close. Supply sergeant wasn't happy about it since he thought that he would need to dispatch a vault person in order to fix the vault. We got released early because of Superbowl, but I didn't care about it. All I wanted to to be as far as possible from the army.

title: Snowy hike in Catskills
text:
Hike in snow for the first time. Got some microspickes just in case just for this hike. Luckily Nastya agreed to do carpool. Gave her cookies just for her for all her hard work. She seem to appreciate it. All I had to do is to drive to her and then she would drive Anvar and I to the trail head. the only bad part about this hike was that it was on Sunday, the work is next day, and that had to wake up at 4 am in order to be on trail on time. On the way there we discussed out outdoor plans and more of the regular small talk. 
The weather was perfect for the hike. Not too cold even if not moving for a short while. I dialed in my layering system for winter hiking. For ~35F all I need base layer, waffles, and a hiking shirt. Rolling sleeves up and down serves a great way to thermoregulate. 
At the beginning of the hike we decided not to wear microspikes since we didn't see any ice. However, not ever 5 minutes in there was an ice sheet on the trail. So all of us had to put them on. Seat pad came in handy. It came in handy during lunch. More practical than poncho liner if I just want to sit down.  I didn't have to put microspikes standing up and be in danger of falling. It was a different sensation wearing microspikes. I didn't feel like I am walking on ice at all. Really enjoyed hiking in snow since all the rocks are covered in snow so don't feel. There is less rock scrambling since snow made trail smooth and made rock scrambling not as tall. 
Some parts of the trail looked like they were from fairy tale. The snow looked really beautiful at tree. Having everything covered in snow makes everything more beautiful compared to barren forest. 
The second part of the hike is where I started struggling a bit. We had to go up to move hilltops. However, my legs were not having it. I didn't have enough endurance to keep up to everyone. At some points quads almost started to cramp if I tried to step up somewhere high such as rock. Still not regretting doing legs yesterday. Felt slightly dehydrated at some point as well. The electrolytes the day prior didn't help as much I wanted. Last uphill was most difficult because it felt endless. there were multiple hilltops before the final one. But I have managed to go there no problem just slower than the rest of the group. On the way on top saw where we backpacked Encampment trail in the fall. Everything looks so different now. After the top it was all downhill literally. The sun was perfect as well since the sun was setting. Kinda felt behind because was getting shots of the the best light possible. We ended the hike just perfectly right before it got dark.
As usually we got something to eat after a long hike. Luckily there is a lot of places for that. Some small talk and what is the best town to live in norther jersey. I was beat from the hike and was feeling excused because of early wake up time. On the way back talked a bit with Nastya. She is alright, but has kids. Before drove home stooped to get some energy drink to be safe. The worst part about it is that I have work the next day.

title: Phone date
text: Had a phone date today. Already found several matched on Hinge. Should have downloaded this app earlier might have met someone already. Mostly doing filtering for people who is are outdoorsy because it is what I am looking for. Overall had a nice conversation. A lot of it circle back on hiking and outdoors stories. Something I am looking towards. Talked for about 47 minutes. Hopefully going to meet in person soon. Too bad that have this drill in the way...again. She speaks Russian which is plus. Invited her to our hiking group as well so she can join. It would work the best if things work out.

title: Improvized hike
text:
This hike I made a route just looking at the map and looking where trail/road is.  There wasn't street view and the parking lot that wanted to park wasn't even in the Goolge maps. Diana asked if even it was correct parking lot since she was concerned if it correct parking lot. On the way there we took more scenic route. One of the roads was closed so we had to turn around and go by the detour. Original road was blocked by cylinder blocks. We turned around and got on detour route. The road was pretty bad, a lot of potholes. Wish that have taken route that approached park from other side. 

The road for parking lot was closed as well. Luckily we have found another parking lot near by. Found another person from out group there. Other people came from other side and I have to send people where we parked. Luckily  it wasn't too big of detour for other people that came from other side. This parking was actually better than the original planned one. We started from cemetery and the start of the creek.

The hike was pretty nice especially in the beginning. A lot of water in the begging. Additionally, the sun was just rising so lighting was almost perfect. However, on the way back there was overcast, and not a great light. There was some snow as well, so it was nice seeing it for the first time this year. Passed by shelter that I stayed when I backpacked by there. Missed turn to Appalachian trail. Had to backtrack just few minutes. Realized that we are going too much downhill. After that we were back to Appalachian trail. It was just regular trail. A lot of up and downs and rocks. Walked a a little bit more than planned since started in other parking lot. Dimka seem little bit annoyed that we walked a little bit more. 

For the most of the hike we had a lot small talk for the most part. The small talk continued to the restaurant as well.

title: Lucky Drill
text:
Another drill. Can't wait to finish everything and be free. Got lucky with drill this time. Didn't have to go to the field, because there was something to do in the armory. We were setting up tents and setting mobile TOC set up in the back of FMTV.  Since we stayed back we weren't sure how we go to the field as well. The bus left, and there weren't any tactical vehicles we can drive there. The first and second day we were still not done with the task. Everyone were happy that we didn't have to be in fort Dix. Vanessa came back from the field, but she stayed with us as well even though she was supposed to grab extra parts from armory. It was nice to have home station drill. It was nice sleeping in my bed and eating real food.

Command sergeant major thinks highly of me. I guess I give out the vibe that I know what I am talking about. Just need to be confident what I am talking about and have more information than other people. Being in for 8 years, gave me a lot of random knowledge and random skill that other people might not have. Other people think the same way about it me as well. Additionally other people think that I live in the forest as well.

We were cleaning out garage, and I found some free stuff that I could take home. Put everything into a milk carton and take it out when no one was outside. Got a survival blanket that I wanted to buy, and med kit that I can put into my car. 

Tovarish tried to shame me for buying car from his work. Like my car is a old and a junk and that I spend a lot of money maintaining it. However, I shut him up saying that my yearly maintenance is cheaper that car payments.

Sandra call me as well since it was my bday. She diffidently doesn't mind getting together. Asking when I will come over or when I will buy ticket for her so that she can come over as well.

title: Work upgrade
text:
Started new work this week. Finally broke into a six figure salary range. First few day were just were just onboarding and setting all the accounts. Security was the pain in ass for the majority of the week. We needed to get appointments to get our contractor badges. The day we had our appointment, the camera to take picture was not connected to security laptop. So we just took pictures and write down what we were wearing during out pictures. The next day that we went the pictures were still not ready, the camera cable was broken and were asked to email picture to security. We were asked to send pictures of our selves to email. However, we can't take any pictures inside of facility to do it. Luckily we were able to get help from some people. They gave security some hardware to transfer pictures from camera to computer, but it took about five minutes for each picture to transfer. At least we are able to get our regular badges now. The next step was to get me an access to closed area. My pin haven't worked right away.

Had a small scare with my job. Was not able to log in to my account for even on Tuesday. On Tuesday, still wasn't access my primary work email. Talked to Ted, a guy from same company, and decided to contact hr/it. Wasn't not sure what that about since I need to input my time sheets as well. Was worried that was out of the job. At the end, the password that I was provided was wrong.  After talking to HR I was able to get my accounts. On a positive note, since there is a time difference from support, the main office is in San Diego, I was able to contact them after my work hours and get support that I needed.

The job is general is not so bad so far. We are recreating application from scratch and using all modern technologies, React, kubernets, AWS. Would be a good importunity to learn relevant technologies. First week is just all planning.

title: Local photography trip
text:
Finally decided to get of the house to explore the area. Didn't feel like going before lunch, but after it had some energy to go out. Additionally, overcast was finally over, so better sky for photography.   Previously had a plan to visit Mt Holly. It has a park that I wanted to explore. The park had some old buildings as well  buildings that are not kept in the best conditions. My favorite part of street photography. The focal length of my lens is perfect for street photography. I hiking I it is more wider, ~ 23mm and street 33mm. Don't think I need prime lens that much. Cant really use low f stop when it is during daylight when it is too bright. The shutter speed in my camera is not fast enough for bright light. 

Visited a cemetery for photography as well. Was walking on a trail first and then went uphill where I was not trail. the cemetery was pretty old, and I was able to get some interesting shots. Continued on trail and saw some interesting graffiti as well. The bridge was closed at one point, but there was a trail around it. The only point I wanted more zoom in my camera when the place was closed and I didn't want to trespass. It had some interesting train cabin. 

Visited "down town" of Mt Holly. It was desolate with not many people walking, but at least buildings looked nice. Looked as old city town centers in midwest. The city has a lot of older buildings that are close together and without garages. Definitely working class people live here.  Some buildings are not kept in the best conditions. At least city is walk able more or less. Not sure if I want to live without garage of older house.

Dimka had his date. He said that she doesn't know what she wants. i told him that she should have a checklist of what attributes she is looking at her partner.

title: Early birthday
text:
Celebrating my birthday earlier since I have drill when my actual birth day is going to be. Good for me Dimka invited people initially two weeks ago. I didn't have access to phone to invite people at work to invite people. Additionally, invited Anvar to the group. It was good idea to invite him since we go hiking a lot in general and see him pretty much every weekend. Overall, it went pretty well with a lot of jokes and socializing.

As usually, we started with Black Run Preserve and food from Whole Foods. It was way colder that we expected. Talked most the time we were there, and went almost the same route as last time. Saw the abandoned car again. Joked that it has penis drawn now. Jokes has become more inappropriate  compared to last time we met. Talked about relationships a bit as well. Yana is going to dates, but she expects too  much and want guys to guess how is she is feeling. 

Dinner was nice as well. Kinda ate too much food, and was supper stuffed at the end. More socializing and joking at the table. Overall good vibes. Roma brought his cake, and it was delicious as always. Played couple songs to people and showed home gym and my helmet. People were interested in them, but for me it was daily occurrence. 

At the end Diana and Anvar left, and rest of us played some board games a bit and continued talking.

title: Unpaid vacation started
text:
Finally enjoying some free time where I don't have to do  anything at all. However, it is unpaid and I am loosing $1k a week which is price of really nice camera lens. I will think that break with doing nothing is going to be good for my mental health. I can work on deploying journal application as well.

Went to see ruins of brick factory. It is something I wanted to do. It is not too far away, but it is only just ruins. It was pretty mid, but I glad that I was able to see them. Too much sprayed paint and trash. Additionally, there was a lot of overcast, so the sky in the pictures might be not pretty. Used phone camera just in case  because it has better hdr processing.

Got phone call from my previous job. Have to sign something from security. They weren't in the office the Friday that I came in. I guess I wasn't that free. All I had to give them is my signature for NDA that's about it.

title: Long hike
text:
Another long hike. Going to a pavilion that where went backpacking before. Nurila joined us this time, and she picked me up. She haven't been hiking for a while. Most of the way there were had a lot of small talk and talk about technology field. Eric forgot my name since I don't use my real name on IG. He thought my name is Slava. Talked for the majority way there. We arrived last, but people  joked that they only waited for us because I bring baked goods for hikes. 

We had steep uphill right away. Nurila was struggling right away since she haven't hiked in a longtime. Waited for her several times. Additionally, she wore wrong jacket. She was wearing really bulky ski jacket. I had to give my yellow vest.However, once we got to the top at fire tower she was able to catch up with us and walk with main group.  After the uphill it was mostly flat or downhill. Had a lunch in the pavilion since it is the only open area. We used a bench as a table and set up table with what people what have brought. Almost people brought insulated bottle with tea with them.

On the way back had to find a correct turn. Used map and compass to estimate where to make a turn. It was fun, and found the right way.  As we went more down, we saw more moss and creeks. I took some pictures of that. Nurila felt down when running and she felt forwards. Her leg got caught by a branch. Luckily there weren't any rocks in the ground.

Fond a cabin middle of nowhere. It was lived in with kitchen and bbq stand. At one point we had a choice to go back uphill to fire tower or go to lake. we decided to go to lake since it would be shorter, but most importantly it had nicer views.

After hike some of us decided to get dinner. The place was two minutes away across the road. The first place that we went was just a bar, and we turned around and went to place that I have been here previously. Had a nice chat and went back home. Nurila asked me to drive back since she was exhausted.

title: Sandra is chubby
text: Got call from Sandra again. She is doing fine, just got chubby. She asked me about it, and I told her the truth. At least she is aware about and wants to do something about it. But I am doubtful that she is going to get to her goal. She doesn't mind her coming over if I buy her a ticket, but I might wait till she is looses some weight before hand that. Other than that she is doing the same. Also, want to move from Cali so that she is able to buy house with some land. Find new work when she is done with her masters.

title: Dobbie is freee
text:
Last days with the company. People found that I am leaving on my last day. A lot of them congratulated me of moving on. Drew wasn't too happy about it since he is already at the edge dealing with the things that he has to do especially that Top is leaving as well. Kaitlyn facepalmed when I said that I am leaving since Adam is leaving as well and she is going going to be totally by herself.

Exit interview was kinda awkward since no one was prepared for me turn in my things. Had to wait in lobby for a little bit to figure things out. HR was kinda condescending that I am leaving the company ans giving a short notice. Asking why I didn't give two week notice and that people are going to be short staffed. General idea that I clearly don't care.

title: One week notice
text: Got email back that I am able to start my new earlier. Not thinking how much notice should I give. At the end this is going to be my last week. Tom is also leaving the company for somewhere else. A lot of people are leaving for some reason. I wounder why. We talked about him leaving in a small group, but I haven't told anyone that I will be leaving really soon as well. Got my notice to manager as well. On a funny side, a lot of charge numbers are gone because of new year because contracts didn't renew in time.

title: Well travelled trail with a twist
text:
Hiking Mt Minsi again. It have been most traveled hike for us. We had about 16 people showed up. However, I knew most of them. It was nice to hike with people who you know. Able to talk with a lot of people. Talked with everyone for the most part. A lot of small talk and catching up with people. People brought food and champagne to celebrate New Years. Had 5 bottles of champagne to drink. Reminds me a lot of my time in college where we brought drinks for a hike. Cheese cake was nice again. People seen to enjoy it. Still need to practice of recipe for only one cheesecake. In the second stop, I used woobie as a table cloth on the second drinking/lunch stop. 

On the way back we took the different way that got here. It was surprisingly nice since there was a nice waterfall with some ice. Unfortunately the sun was facing wrong direction so that the sun was blown out. On camera pictures. Additionally, a lot of things were slippery, and I even slipped on my back. Too good for me by backpack with a lot/extra things soften the fall. Nastya D asked me why I didn't bring guitar with me since it would be perfect for it. Nice lunch and live music. No one decided to go for dinner afterwards since we ate a lot during our break. However, stopped at McDonald for some food and coffee. I was kinda tired, and coffee helped. About hour after I got home I just felt asleep.

title: Think when start new work
text:
Thinking when should actually start new work. Looked again at drill schedule and I might be able to start week or two weeks earlier. Thinking about the loss of income if I take too long of a break. My week worth is at least $1k. Not sure how much is free time I want since can get lens  for the time I work. Might contact hr if I can start earlier

Went to a smaller part around here. Finally saw that alien looking building. The part was way bigger that I expected. 

Got a call from Sandra after I messaged her about her trip to Nor Cal. She dropped her phone into hot tub when I can a call
